attributes.action: allow married partners. where one stays at home full time to look after pre-school age children, to transfer their unused tax allowances to the working partner.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is widely accepted that both children and Society benefit from children spending their formative (pre-school years) with their parents rather than being in the care of third parties. 

However, the choice for one person to stay at home has to be balanced against a consequential reduced family income

If we accept that the days when couples attracted additional allowances simply for being married are now lost then this scheme would at least allow the sacrifice of one income to be offset marginally by the transfer of all allowances to the working partner.

It wouldn't make couples £000's better off but it would help and at least give some the boost they need to be able to look after their kids themselves.

The Govt should do it because it is the right thing to do.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
